7.6.23  1:54 pm   is it jazz that is jazz or is it the SPIRIT of jazz that truly is what it is

      jazz is jazz. i checked it on a calculator

7.6.23  1:16 pm   How did you come up with your style?

      i imagine things way outside of my capability zone, and then after some intense disappointment i settle for doing whatever i can

7.6.23  9:51 am   it seems that you use traditional grip (left hand is upside down) while drumming. is that how you learned it?

     i started matched, then in 4th grade in gym class a basketball hit me in the middle finger and temporarily jammed it so i couldn't bend it for about a week. that's when i realized that it's actually possible to use traditional grip without bending that finger. so i switched to traditional until the finger got better, and then i never switched back

     if you were to relearn drumming from scratch, what grip would you choose?

     trad is rad. that's just the way it is

7.6.23  7:35 am   how do you get the motivation to complete a song when you think others won't enjoy it?

      i guess at some point you realize that it is possible, to make things that are indeed enjoyed. very much. you've seen other people do it. so, after seeing it's possible, if you then have a deep conviction that that can be you, should be, could be, is gonna be you, ....... then it's gonna be you. and you make it happen

7.6.23  5:04 am   What are your thoughts on immortality. 

      seems normal, but i don't know if anyone has it

7.6.23  12:31 am   So have you ever thought about if aliens have their own version of the internet?

     the internet as we know it seems like 1 stage in an extremely rapid transition, relatively speaking. kind of like that first raindrop in the rainstorm. but in the vast scope of the universe, sure i'd say it's safe to estimate that someone else is indeed having that first raindrop right at this moment as we speak

     Follow-up question if you have thought about it do you also imagine them using it for mostly silly pointless things like we humans do?

     well let's unpack the implicit thesis you just snuck into the question, which is that you think the internet is mostly silly and pointless. i disagree with that part, and then about the aliens i'd say their internet wouldn't be pointless either. ask them why they made it. if you don't understand their reason, then that might be just a language barrier

7.5.23  10:56 pm   can i interpret the meaning of 'just did a bad thing' as being sad about life and how you're supposed to live it and being lonely?

     sure, although i don't hear it that way

     .... or perhaps it's just a nice song.

     i tried to put some not-nice parts in there to balance out the nice parts

7.5.23  10:50 pm   do you like the sound of bells? or do you prefer the sound of wind chimes?

      wind chimes are bells, but if you choose nice bells then yes i like the windchimes, and the bells therein

7.5.23  10:42 pm   who invented god

      the church, but it's based on whatever it would be before the church was there. unfortunately that's a little hard to put on paper

7.5.23  8:02 pm   If you were invited to sing in We Are The World 2, would you do it?

      sure

7.5.23  4:56 pm   Your opinion on worms?

      each worm is descended from the Grand Worme

7.5.23  4:47 pm   what's for breakfast?

      just a bit of ontbijten

7.5.23  4:18 pm   there seems to be two opposing advices when it comes to creation and the "big idea". some suggest putting it on hold until you feel confident enough in your skill to tackle it without "wasting" the idea. But another seems to imply that other big ideas will keep coming so just focusing on it now is good. I feel like the first advice can end up making someone to never work on that one thing they really wanted to put out there for fear of never being ready. Since they could always improve more before tackling it. Maybe its just a matter of feeling ready? and maybe some people are adventurous enough to feel ready asap? maybe its not about being adventurous idk, im just kind of brainstorming and maybe projecting my own personal feelings towards this situation. Do you feel like writing a lot of songs makes you feel ready to tackle "big ideas" in other mediums/formats like storytelling? or do you feel its a different scenario enough to feel like you need to work yourself up to the more ambitious or attached-to ideas. One thing seems for sure though, if there is only one idea im passionate about, it feels obvious to tackle that one, but if more come it makes sense to hold off on the one i may be more-attached to or more ambitious about. I guess my "bad" feeligns towards the advice of holding until one feels ready is the assumption that it forces one to focus on things one is not passionate about. and it may come from a completely subjective situation of being REALLY passionate about one thing right now and the idea of forcing myself to focus on something else feeling like a dam would be placed in this current world building flow.

     you can go ahead and work on the big favorite. but if you're too scared, then maybe you can't. now, you may ask, "is that ok?" and it reminds me of when they ask, in restaurants, "is Pepsi ok?" and the answer of course is no. pepsi is not ok. nothing is ok

7.5.23  3:57 pm   Do you like synthesizers, like the cool analog ones that are large and have all the buttons and blinking lights?

      they are cool as long as i don't have to move them anywhere

7.5.23  3:30 pm   on your youtube, there is a song called "got some money," whereas on your snogs page, there is a song called "money.". after listening to both of these, i believe them to be the same song. if this is the case, then is this intentional?

      the name of the song is "money". the name of the video is "got some money" to make it more obvious that it's a song. a video titled "money" almost seems like it would be a video about money. but that's not quite what it is. "got some money" seemed like a better representation of what the video actually is: a music video

7.5.23  2:37 pm   Hello! I love everything you do, you inspire me a lot! And it's my first time ever asking you here... I don't know what you're up to now, and you answered some time ago that you're not on schedule anymore, at least what you considered as a schedule. But when you was on it, what were you doing on the weekends, saturdays and sundays?

     in the course of the 3 week cycle, the first sat/sun i'd probably be in the writing stage. the second sat/sun i'd probably be somewhere in the music production stage. and in the 3rd sat/sun i'd probably be slamming my way through graphics and video production

     
They're the days off,

     not for that schedule. the days off would be like the first 3 days of the 3-week cycle, which would be the first wed,thur,fri

      but what do you consider as a rest for you?

     doing whatever i want

     Do you totally don't learn anything,

     learning is usually the best thing to do during that time. learning whatever i want

     don't try to finish some unfinished songs,

     don't really 'try' to do anything, except listen to the instincts of what i want to do, or what i'm curious about

     don't sort your music, don't write scenarios?

     only if i'm really really in the mood to do it

      Do you just sleep or going for a walk or watch movies or interviews all day?

     could happen

      What would you recommend me to do to feel good for next week and do you think it's really necessary to take them, i feel really excited to write music and art everyday, but will i burn out of it if i will do it like that all this time?

     not if you're excited

      maybe you experienced this already and if so what would you do then? thank you in advance

7.4.23  4:00 pm   in "money", when you say "i said it 3 or 4 songs ago", are you actually referencing a previous song or is it a meaningless lyric?

      it's evoking multiple meanings. "hello, it's a tuesday show, cuz wednesday seems so long ago. i said it 3 or 4 songs ago. IT'S TIME FOR THE SHOW". Whether i'm referring to saying 'hello', or mentioning the 'tuesday show' or mentioning 'tuesday' then 'wednesday' in succession like that in a song, or simply declaring "it's time for the show", all of those are things i've either said before, or put in a song before. So that's 5 things at once that it means, and the 3-or-4-songs-ago is just an estimation, because all those things happened varying degrees of time ago. In the cases of things being put into songs, it's usually more than 4 songs ago, giving a whimsical over-casual sense to the estimate, but then the incidents where i've just said them (such as talked about them here on this page, or in notes, or otherwise in life) expressed things such as the desire to have a regularly occuring show, my preference for Tuesday for such an event, in those cases, the "3 or 4 songs ago" is just a way of mentioning time. indeed, when we say "3 or 4 days ago", we say "days" because days are something that happen so often and so regularly that they can be used to measure time. so it can also be seen that i'm sort of wistfully refering to 'songs' as something so regular and frequent that they ought to be used to measure time, even if just in casual estimation. most of all, all these meanings likely converge on "it's time for the show", which is indeed something that came out in an improv, in a similarly decisive and succinct way. these are the various meanings of that line, in context of the lines surrounding it

7.4.23  3:00 pm   wait, i have to work for my ambitions? i have to apply a force across a distance for it? i got to accelerate a mass across a distance for it? i need to change the velocity of a mass across a distance for it? i'm sorry, i'm so lazy that such a fact is new to me

      maybe you can invent a device that will allow you to apply the same force with less work

7.4.23  2:13 pm   okay i know that 4/4 means 4 quarter-notes in a bar, and that 7/8 means 7 eighth-notes in a bar, but what's a bar?

     a segment of time in the music, like those big sidewalk squares are a segmnt of the sidewalk

      and what's a quarter note and a whole note?

     in most cases, a quarter note is 1 'beat' worth of time. a beat is typically the length of time that would recieve one foot tap, if you are foot tapping. in the normal time-signature (4/4) a quarter note is one beat. the 4/4 time signature is so normal that the quarter note (and thus all the notes) have been named in relation to a bar of 4/4. a quarter note is a quarter of the length of a bar in 4/4. and a whole note is the length of 4 quarter notes. in different time signatures, with different bar lengths, these names don't actually relate to the bar. the names are kept as if they are relating to a 4/4 bar, just because that's their name. at that point it's just a name

      does it relate to the tempo?

     yes. the tempo is measured in 'beats per minute'. so indeed if you increase he tempo, it means the quarter notes will go faster, the whole bar will go faster. the whole song will go faster. tempo markings often show a little note to actually indicate what one 'beat' note is. ♩=100 means there are 100 quarter notes per minute. ♪=100 means there are 100 eighth notes per minute
